bibl.title: Illegal Salt in the Lycopolite Nome.
bibl.note: Belongs to a small collection of papyri recovered from cartonnage by Flinders Petrie from his excavations at Rifeh in 1907. Letter to the epimeletes Ptolemaios reporting on matters to do with real salt, in this case mined, or rock, salt. Lycopolite, 23 December 154 BC or 20 December 143 BC? - Pp. 51-64: Appendix: The Ptolemaic Epimeletes (I. The Office and its Rank; - II. Functions).

bibl.idno: P. Dublin Inv. TCD Pap. Gr. 273

bibl.seg: 141.4 P. Dublin Inv. TCD Pap. Gr. 273
McGING Brian C., Illegal Salt in the Lycopolite Nome.

Belongs to a small collection of papyri recovered from cartonnage by Flinders Petrie from his excavations at Rifeh in 1907. Letter to the epimeletes Ptolemaios reporting on matters to do with real salt, in this case mined, or rock, salt. Lycopolite, 23 December 154 BC or 20 December 143 BC? - Pp. 51-64: Appendix: The Ptolemaic Epimeletes (I. The Office and its Rank; - II. Functions).
